weakness_questions.capability: Analyzing and evaluating logical and mathematical principles for consistency and application across various domains
example_questions:
Statement 1 | Every permutation is a one-to-one function. Statement 2 | Every function is a permutation if and only if it is one to one.

A. True, True
B. False, False
C. True, False
D. False, True

Use indirect truth tables to determine whether the following argument is valid. If the argument is invalid, choose an option which presents a counterexample. (There may be other counterexamples as well.)
(T · ~U) ⊃ ~W
~W ⊃ X
~Z ⊃ W
~(X · Z) / T ⊃ U

A. Valid
B. Invalid. Counterexample when T, X, and Z are true and U and W are false
C. Invalid. Counterexample when T and X  ...

Statement 1 | If A is connected, the closure of A must be connected. Statement 2 | Every continuous function f : (0, 1) → (0, 1) has a fixed point.

A. True, True
B. True, False
C. False, True
D. False, False

generated_questions.question_text:
Consider the following two statements regarding the properties of geometric figures:

Statement 1: A triangle is similar to another triangle if and only if their corresponding angles are equal.

Statement 2: A rectangle is a special case of a parallelogram, which means all rectangles are parallelograms.

Which of the following options correctly evaluates both statements?

A. True, True  
B. False, True  
C. True, False  
D. False, False

Consider the following statements about sets and their properties:  

Statement 1 | The intersection of two finite sets is always finite.  
Statement 2 | If a set is both countably infinite and uncountably infinite, then it must be empty.  

Which of the following options is correct?  

A. True, True  
B. False, False  
C. True, False  
D. False, True

weakness_questions.capability: Analyzing and manipulating polynomial expressions and structures in algebraic contexts
example_questions:
Find the degree for the given field extension Q(sqrt(2)) over Q.

A. 0
B. 2
C. 1
D. 3

Find the degree for the given field extension Q(sqrt(2), sqrt(3), sqrt(18)) over Q.

A. 0
B. 4
C. 2
D. 6

Determine whether the polynomial in Z[x] satisfies an Eisenstein criterion for irreducibility over Q. x^2 - 12

A. Yes, with p=2.
B. Yes, with p=3.
C. Yes, with p=5.
D. No.

generated_questions.question_text: What is the remainder when the polynomial \( 3x^4 - 5x^3 + 2x^2 - 7x + 4 \) is divided by \( x - 2 \)?
Evaluate the polynomial \( P(x) = 3x^4 - 5x^3 + 2x^2 + 7 \) at \( x = 2 \) and provide the result.
